info.title: JWKS
info.description: JWKS API - enables partners to verify the authenticity of a compact JWS token using a JWKS process

Bearer.description: Provide a valid bearer token in the Authorization header. Example: 'Authorization: Bearer {app_token}'

post.description:
Create a new compact JWS token that can be used to authenticate a staff member to an app in inTandem using a JWKS process.

## Overview
The token is signed by inTandem's private key and can be verified using the public JWKS endpoint.

## When to Use
- Authenticate a staff member to a third-party app
- Generate secure, verifiable tokens for app integrations

## Prerequisites
- Valid Staff Token or AppStaffToken
- The app must be authorized for token signing for the staff member

## Public JWKS Endpoint
Public keys for verification: `https://api.vcita.biz/v3/apps/.well-known/jwks.json`

## Notes
- Token has a limited validity period (check `expiry_date` in response)
- Each token has a unique `uid` for tracking

app_code_name.description: The code name of the app that owns this token. Must be a non-empty string.

200.description: A compact JWS token is successfully created.

400.description: Bad Request. Invalid request body or app_code_name is empty.

401.description: Unauthorized. The bearer token is missing, invalid, or the staff is not authorized to sign tokens for the specified app.

429.description: Rate limit has been reached due to the number of requests made for the same staff member in a short period of time.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Token signing failed.

post.description:
Create multiple compact JWS tokens for a list of app code names in a single request.

## Overview
This endpoint allows generating tokens for multiple apps at once, with individual success/failure status for each.

## When to Use
- Generate tokens for multiple apps simultaneously
- Reduce API calls when a staff member needs access to several apps

## Prerequisites
- Valid Staff Token or AppStaffToken
- At least one app_code_name must be provided

## Response Structure
The response contains an array where each item indicates:
- `success: true` with token data if successful
- `success: false` with error message if failed (e.g., unauthorized for that app)

## Notes
- Each app_code_name is validated independently
- Partial success is possible - some tokens may succeed while others fail
- Tokens for unauthorized apps will return individual error messages

app_code_names.description: List of app code names for which JWS tokens need to be generated. Must contain at least one non-empty string.

200.description: Bulk creation completed. Check individual items for success/failure status.

success.description: Status of the creation for this specific app. true = token generated, false = error occurred.

data.description: The generated JWS token data (present when success is true)

error.description: Error message explaining why token creation failed (present when success is false)

compact_jws_tokens.error: Unauthorized to sign token for app helpdesk for staff

400.description: Bad Request. Invalid request body or app_code_names array is empty.

401.description: Unauthorized. The bearer token is missing or invalid.

429.description: Rate limit has been reached due to the number of requests made for the same staff member in a short period of time.
